name: Fifteen Waste
desc: Perfectly generic, these shoes are popular among artists. These shoes are constantly recycled; when traded back to Terracycle for supplies, they are repurposed into new pairs and redistributed to their employees. As such, working at Terracycle is quite dangerous; shoes are in high demand.

name: Air Jordan CCXIV
desc: These shoes have spiked toes and muscle-activated thrusters on the heels. Due to their capability for assisting in fast travel in addition to combat, they are known as 'Heelys' in some circles.

name: Snow Star
desc: Mountain climbing shoes with the ability to expand and become snow shoes. Being low quality, they often get stuck in one form or the other, making them difficult to use.

name: Ultraboost 112
desc: The third in Adidas' line of travel shoes, the Ultraboost pair allows nearly 360° movement in the air. As they are spike-tipped, they're often called 'Luxury Heelys,' in reference to the cheaper brand.

name: Blazer Mid 7077
desc: Flamethrower shoes. Though they are strong in combat, their lack of travel functionality and tendancy to sweep the user off their feat bring them down somewhat.

name: New Challenger
desc: The ultimate in combat shoes. Spiked tips, full force-field, 360° muscle-activated thrusters, front-facing blasters; there is a reason they're so pricey.

name: Alphabounce++++
desc: High jump shoes, to the extreme. Capable of launching a full-size person to 30 feet, but with no method of getting down, these shoes are used as a method of execution; you either take a step, launching yourself to your death, or you starve.

name: Alphabounce+++++
desc: High jump shoes with light thrusters. Useful for not perishing from the 30 foot fall.

name: Power Sandals
desc: These shoes were designed to launch explosives, but the launchers don't work.

name: Safety Shoe 2
desc: These shoes are for protecting your feet from danger. As such, they are airtight. Release mechanism not included.
